isis.stitle: FRONT STEER AXLE: EATON EFA-12 - INSPECT - WHEEL BEARING INSPECTION

svcproc.title: WHEEL BEARING INSPECTION

step1.para: Remove bearings. Clean bearings, spindle, hub cap and hub cavity with a suitable commercial solvent.
Inspect cups, rollers and cones for wear or damage. The photographs in this section of the manual can be used as a guide to inspect the bearings.

note.para: Bearings normally fail after they have lived their expected life. Premature wear or fatigue can be caused by improper installation, incorrect adjustment or lack of lubrication.

svcproc.para: As a guide for inspecting bearing condition, the three photographs ( Figure 17, Figure 18, Figure 19) illustrate various stages of wear.

Break-In (uneven wear) ( Figure 17).
This cup displays an uneven wear pattern typical in low mileage with light or moderate loads. It is caused by the bearing preload applied during assembly and will gradually become more even as mileage increases. If not otherwise damaged, parts showing this wear pattern can be reused.

High mileage (normal wear) ( Figure 18).
This bearing cup is evenly worn in a manner common for advanced mileage with normal loading. It is lightly pitted because of contaminants in the lubricant and would be replaced before it reached an advanced stage.

Bearing failure (damaged) ( Figure 19).
This cup has been badly bruised by hard metal particles in the lubricant. If reused, it would probably begin spalling or flaking within a short time. It should be replaced.
